DOC.HEAD: SPECIAL EDITION
Bride & Groom: Brites
LaserPhoto NY704
DOC.TEXT: Wedding bells are all right, but those who get married in the Oklahoma County Courthouse in Oklahoma City can no longer celebrate with rice or birdseed. Oklahoma County Commissioners have voted to ban the throwing of rice, birdseed, confetti and other similar substances in and around the courthouse. Rice and birdseed traditionally have been tossed at weddings as symbols of fertility, but the commissioners' action apparently was not an effort to limit population growth. Commissioner F.G. ``Buck'' Buchanan says the policy was enacted as a safety measure. ``We've had people who have been hurt by sliding on rice and so forth.'' _ A French designer has created a wedding dress valued at $7.3 million, requiring a squad of guards at its modeling in Paris. Designed and made by couturier Helene Gainsville for her 1990 bridal collection, the lace gown is embroidered with 723 white diamonds. Alexandre Reza of Place Vendome selected the jewels for the dress, which took more than 3,000 hours to create.
